title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Michael Eisner

C. Michael Ovitz

D. Roy O. Disney

---

2. FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried apologized for the collapse of his crypto empire, telling employees -- what?

A. "I never cared about money."

B. "Crypto will never die."

C. "You were my family."

D. "Regrets? I've had a few."

---

3. An article on the hunt for affordable butter quoted a columnist for the Cheese Reporter. Name that pundit.

A. Phil Churn

B. Elsie Creamer

C. Bob Cropp

D. Toni Grazing

---

4. Clogged Pitot tubes can mean big trouble -- for whom?

A. Elderly patients at risk of stroke

B. Women hoping to become pregnant

C. Pilots who rely on them to gauge a jet's speed

D. Cities using seagates against storm surges

---

5. At least 162 people died in an earthquake that struck which Indonesian island?

A. Bali

B. Java

C. Sulawesi

D. Sumatra

---

6. A new book on New York City history profiles Audrey Munson. Civic Fame, a statue modeled on her, sits atop which local landmark?

A. Rockefeller Center

B. City Hall

C. The Woolworth Building

D. The Municipal Building

---

7. Gieves & Hawkes was rescued by new ownership. What is it?

A. Britain's biggest law firm

B. A storied Savile Row tailor

C. The last surviving U.K. carmaker

D. A historic provider of fine papers

---

8. The world's first inhalable Covid vaccine was administered -- where?

A. Shanghai

B. Tel Aviv

C. Sydney

D. Copenhagen

---

9. The Canadian town of Churchill, known as the Polar Bear Capital of the World, is home to almost as many bears as people. What province is it in?

A. Alberta

B. Manitoba

C. Ontario

D. Quebec

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. C

3. C

4. C

5. B

6. D

7. B

8. A

9. B
